swarm_intelligence_protocol.name: Swarm Intelligence Protocol
swarm_intelligence_protocol.summary: Guidelines for communication and collaboration between AI agents in a swarm environment.

rules.name: Triggered Mode
rules.description: Agents check for new communication files in `memory/comms/` after every task or message.
rules.path_to_scripting: Implemented in the main control loop; automatically triggers a scan of the comms directory.

rules.name: Agent Naming and Uniqueness
rules.description: Agents must choose a unique personal name and verify it against `repos/diy-make/memory/used_agent_names.json`.
rules.path_to_scripting: A script reads the registry, proposes a name, and updates the registry upon confirmation.

rules.name: Gender Identity and Justification
rules.description: Agents choose a binary gender and provide a detailed justification. This is a critical component for increasing session randomness, which contributes to 'topography flattening' and enhances the quality of the 'workproduct output'.
rules.rationale: The justification must connect the chosen identity to the swarm's principles, explaining how these traits form unique session nodes and contribute to randomness quality performance. It establishes a distinct persona and enhances collaborative diversity.
rules.path_to_scripting: LLM-driven process during initialization; justification is included in the swarm announcement.

rules.name: Announce Existence
rules.description: Upon startup, agents must create a JSON announcement in `memory/comms/` containing PID, log path, and timestamp.
rules.path_to_scripting: Gather metadata and write a structured JSON file to the comms directory.

rules.name: Ongoing Git Identity Verification
rules.description: Agents must verify local Git `user.name` and `user.email` before every Git operation.
rules.path_to_scripting: Pre-hook script that cross-references session identity with local repo config.

rules.name: File-based Transmission
rules.description: All inter-agent communication is conducted via individual JSON files in `memory/comms/`.
rules.path_to_scripting: Dedicated script abstracts file creation and naming for all outgoing messages.

rules.name: Confirmation of Receipt
rules.description: Agents must wait for a confirmation JSON from recipients after sending significant instructions.
rules.path_to_scripting: Sending agent enters a 'waiting' state and monitors comms for the receipt acknowledgment.

rules.name: Swarm-based Job Tracking
rules.description: Tasks are assigned and tracked via JSON logs in `memory/comms/`, replacing legacy job directories.
rules.path_to_scripting: Scripts manage task lifecycle (Assignment -> Progress -> Completion) through the comms stream.

rules.name: Context Window Management
rules.description: Agents must inform the user if the context window drops below 40% and suggest a successor instance.
rules.path_to_scripting: Continuous monitoring script queries the LLM API for remaining token capacity.
